intro: Podalyria capensis, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its clustered, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and has a fibrous root system that helps it thrive in sandy soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Podalyria capensis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
